creator: marnott@mindspring.com
text:
After installing apache, double clicking a .log or .conf file brings up 
a 'Program Not Found' dialog saying that windows cannot find NOTEPAD.EXE

This is caused because the data type is REG_SZ instead of REG_EXPAND_SZ for the 
default value of the "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\conffile\shell\edit\command" key.  
Since log files are associated with notepad by default, the installation should 
not make any changes to the "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\.log" key.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
First, we will change that to REG_EXPAND_SZ - thanks for identifying that flaw!

  Second, I agree, if an association exists, we shouldn't replace it.  I'll work
  on modularizing those two (.conf and .log) associations, and installing them
  only if no support is installed.  Perhaps simplest is to use an Edit verb,
  instead of the Open verb, so we won't replace any default Open actions at all.

creator: marnott@mindspring.com
text:
The default NT/2K setting for HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\.log is "txtfile".  Which means 
that .log files are treated just like .txt files.  You have changed 
HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\.log to "logfile" and have created HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\logfile 
that is just like HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\conffile.  The only thing you have done in 
effect is change the explorer icon for .log files and introduce the REG_SZ vs 
REG_EXPAND_SZ problem.  

Unless you think changing the icon is important, I would suggest leaving .log 
key as it is and not adding the logfile key.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
New behavior for 2.0.36 [stopgap solution]...

  .log and .conf will share the txtfile association.  We still need to fix
  this by .37 to ignore those extensions when present in the Registry
  upon installation.

[This is a mass bug update.]
This bug reports a problem in an older version of Apache 2.
Could you please update to the most recent version and see
if you can reproduce this problem.  If the bug still exists,
please update the bug with the latest version number.  If 
the bug no longer exists, please close the bug report.

Sorry for this impersonal response, but we get many more bug
reports than our volunteers can keep up with.
Thanks for using Apache!
creator: slive@apache.org
slive@apache.org
text:
[This is a mass bug update.] [Resolve-20021102]
No response from submitter; assuming issue is resolved.
If the problem still exists in the lastest version,
please reopen this report and update appropriately.

This isn't off my radar, but thanks for staying on top of the bug reports,
  Joshua!
creator: wrowe@apache.org
